Description: Model building carved from limestone; reproducing an Egyptian house or shrine with a doorway and two windows; partially covered parapet surrounding three edges of the roof; red and black painted decoration round doorway.
Curator's comments: Published: M. Stead. Egyptian Life (1994). p. 10, fig. 10 Shaw and Nicholson. BM Dictionary of Ancient Egypt. (2002) p. 293

A painted limestone shrine from the falcon catacombs in Saqqara offers a good parallel to this piece (Green 1987, 25, fig. 37). From Naukratis, see also the shrine or house's models: Cairo, Egyptian Museum TR19/3/24/6 and JE28784. Green, C. I. 1987, The Temple furniture from the Sacred Animal Necropolis at North Saqqâra 1964-1976 (Egypt Exploration Society Memoirs 53), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XVIII, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CF.1)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 2 Feb-18 Jul, Germany, Mannheim, Reiss-Engelhorn-Museen, Von Babylon Bis Jerusalem: Die Welt der altorientalischen Konigsstadte 2000 Feb-May, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Ancient Faces
